DOC.brief_summary: Research study show type fat diet may affect breast cancer risk . Fish oil fish contain increase amount omega 3 fatty acid appear stop slow growth development breast cancer cell laboratory study mice breast cancer cell . The use omega 3 fatty acid reduce risk breast cancer development human adequately study . Eating fish take fish oil may increase amount omega 3 breast , may lower one 's risk breast cancer development . Persons study one following : ( 1 ) take two capsule daily omega 3 fatty acid supplement , ( 2 ) eat several serving can salmon / tuna per week total three month . Amounts omega 3 fatty acid body 's tissue measure blood test small sample breast fat obtain fine needle aspiration . This study support funding National Fisheries Institute , Food Innovation Center The Ohio State University , The Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center .
DOC.brief_title: Dietary Fish Omega 3 Fatty Acids Breast Cancer Prevention
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective study : . ) Determine effect increase fish consumption serum breast fat tissue fatty acid woman high risk develop breast cancer relative omega 3 fatty acid supplement ; ii . ) Assess adherence tolerability increase dietary intake fish relative omega 3 fatty acid supplement . Secondary objective include : iii . ) Evaluate possible correlation physical factor body mass index ( BMI ) dietary factor target tissue effect . iv . ) Explore additional biomarkers surrogate endpoint measure effect fish consumption .
DOC.criteria: Increased risk breast cancer base family history , personal history Normal mammogram , clinical breast examination past 12 month > 1 year pregnancy , lactation chemotherapy Concurrent malignancy metastatic malignancy kind History bleeding tendency , use anticoagulant medication Inability undergo fine needle aspiration breast adipose tissue Chronic use omega3 fatty acid supplement regular consumption > 2 meals/servings fish per week within 3 month prior entry study supplement might interact omega3 fatty acid supplement Known sensitivity allergy fish Standing regimen full dose aspirin ( 325 mg/day ) , Nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) NSAIDcontaining product .
